intro: Hibiscus linearis, commonly known as the narrowleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Hibiscus linearis is a perennial herb that blooms from summer to fall, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for wetland restoration and ornamental gardening.
